想.definition: to think (about); to think of; to devise; to think (that); to believe (that); to desire; to want (to); to miss (feel wistful about the absence of)

想不到.definition: unexpected; hard to imagine; it had not occurred to me; who could have thought that

想不通.definition: unable to understand; unable to get over

想不開.definition: cannot figure out; to be unable to take a lighter view; to take things too hard; to be depressed; to fret over trifles

想入非非.definition: to indulge in fantasy (idiom); to let one's imagination run wild

想出.definition: to figure out; to work out (a solution etc); to think up; to come up with (an idea etc)

想到.definition: to think of; to call to mind; to anticipate

想得美.definition: to have an unrealistically optimistic expectation; (as an interjection) what a dreamer!

想得開.definition: to not take to heart; to be free of worried thoughts; to adopt a lighthearted perspective; lighthearted

想必.definition: presumably; probably; in all likelihood; surely

想念.definition: to miss; to remember with longing; to long to see again

想方設法.definition: to think up every possible method (idiom); to devise ways and means; to try this, that and the other

想望.definition: to desire; to wish; (literary) to admire

想法.definition: way of thinking; opinion; notion; to think of a way (to do sth)

想當然.definition: to take sth as given; to make assumptions

想當然爾.definition: to take sth as given; to assume; as one would expect; naturally

想當然耳.definition: variant of 想當然爾|想当然尔[xiang3 dang1 ran2 er3]

想要.definition: to want to; to feel like; to fancy; to care for sb; desirous of

想起.definition: to recall; to think of; to call to mind

想通.definition: to figure out; to realize; to become convinced; to come round (to an idea); to get over it

想開.definition: to get over (a shock, bereavement etc); to avoid dwelling on unpleasant things; to accept the situation and move on
